sentences: Ta mainis, et tuleb homme kooli.
PÃ¤rast kohtumist ta mainis oma plaane.
context: 'Mainis' is the past tense form of the Estonian verb 'mainida', which means 'to mention' or 'to refer to'. It is used when someone has brought something up in conversation or referred to something that was previously discussed. The verb indicates an action of bringing something to attention or making reference to it.
